intro: Psychotria ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-eyed orchid, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant characterized by its striking yellow petals and greenish-white sepals. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are small but numerous, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Psychotria ochroleuca is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
